sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• tafamidis has centralized marketing authorization by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for use in the European Union (EU)
  • if vomiting occurs after administration and capsule is not identified, no additional dose is necessary; if capsule is identified, administer another dose
  • Amyloidogenic transthyretin amyloidosis - Polyneuropathy, Stage 1; symptomatic: 20 mg ORALLY once daily added to standard of care (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: no relevant use in pediatric patients younger than 18 years

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• renal impairment: no dose adjustment necessary
  • hepatic impairment (mild to moderate): no dose adjustment necessary
  • elderly (65 years or older): no dose adjustment necessary

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Amyloidogenic transthyretin amyloidosis - Polyneuropathy, Stage 1; symptomatic

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to tafamidis or any component of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• hepatic impairment, severe
  • hereditary fructose intolerance; product contains sorbitol
  • pregnancy should be avoided; effective contraception required during therapy and for 1 month after therapy discontinuation

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea (10% or greater), Upper abdominal pain (1% to less than 10%)
  • Renal:Urinary tract infectious disease (10% or greater)
  • Reproductive:Infective vaginitis (1% to less than 10%)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • swallow capsules whole, do not crush or cut
  • take with or without food
